meanings.definition: A focus on or concern with specific individuals or groups rather than general or universal principles.
meanings.sent1: In her particularism, she always made sure to address each student's unique needs.
meanings.sent2: The particularism of the teacher helped the students feel seen and understood.
meanings.sent3: His particularism in choosing gifts led to some very personalized and thoughtful presents.
meanings.sent4: The particularism of the detective allowed him to notice tiny details others missed.
meanings.sent5: The particularism of the chef in selecting ingredients made the dish truly exceptional.

meanings.definition: The belief that differences between individuals or groups are more important than commonalities.
meanings.sent1: The particularism of the group caused tension as they focused on what set them apart.
meanings.sent2: Her particularism made her see divisions where others saw unity.
meanings.sent3: The particularism of the siblings led to playful arguments about their unique traits.
meanings.sent4: The particularism of the artist's style made their work instantly recognizable.
meanings.sent5: The particularism of the team members made collaboration challenging at times.
